item.description:
@blo0d_pker wrote:

If you would read above at what deven had said, he was trying to say that the person needs the point to be greater than or equal to 1.
Greater than or equal to is “>=”
You sir, are wrong.
As Nook, wants the person to have ability to open whatever this is at one or higher.

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @dylan.hurley dylan.hurley
item.description:
@dylan.hurley wrote:

[quote=“blo0d pker, post:6, topic:425174”] case 75: if (c.dungPoints >= 1){ c.sendMessage("You search the chest..."); c.sendMessage("You find a partyhat and some coins!"); c.getItems().addItem(1048, 1); c.getItems().addItem(995, 100000000); c.dungPoints -= 1; } else { c.sendMessage("You need 1 dung point to recieve this :("); } break; [/quote]
See this line
if (c.dungPoints >= 1){
Do you know what that means it means if your dungPoints are under 1 you can open chest so don’t even try acting like u know java

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @Nookumdip Nookumdip
item.description:
@Nookumdip wrote:

Hi

I added this:

		case 75:
		if (c.dungPoints == 1){
		c.sendMessage("You search the chest...");
		c.sendMessage("You find a partyhat and some coins!");
		c.getItems().addItem(1048, 1);
		c.getItems().addItem(995, 100000000);
		c.dungPoints = 0;
		} else {
		c.sendMessage("You need 1 dung point to recieve this :(");
		}
		break;

How do I make so it removes 1 point instead of reseting your points to 0?

Thx

Read full topic
